page.title: 18Sport in Ditchling
page.content: The Cricket Club runs two teams on Saturday and another on Sunday. Each year there is a well supported Cricket Week honoured by a visit by the M.C.C. every other year. (Ditchling was used to illustrate the enthusiasm for the game in village life in the book "Cornerstones of English Cricket"). There are three football clubs in Ditchling _ two playing soccer and the third rugby. The Village of Ditchling Football Club and the Rugby Club have playing facilities in the field in Lewes Road whilst the other football club plays on a field outside the village. The ancient game of Stoolball is very popular amongst the ladies and their team plays in sixteen local leagues. Juniors are encouraged to carry on the tradition of this unique Sussex game. Two hard tennis courts are also available for the Tennis Club
